metadata.title: CVE-2016-9118 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap Buffer Overflow (WRITE of size 4) in function pnmtoimage ofconvert.c:1719 in OpenJPEG 2.1.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9118` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1').
openjpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'changes too intrusive').
